partners.partnerDescription: Trella brings innovative and environmentally sustainable technologies to industry growers.  CEO Aja Atwood has said it is not lost on her as a black female entrepreneur – a group that has traditionally seen their innovations exploited -- that the company holds a patent for technology that will disrupt the status quo in traditional indoor farming.

Fernway is the top-selling cannabis vape brand in Massachusetts. An independent local business run by people who are passionate cannabis consumers themselves, Fernway is known for its top-shelf terpenes, award-winning recyclable products, and its innovative commitment to minimizing waste and promoting sustainability.

Marijuana Justice (MJVA) was co-founded by Chelsea Higgs Wise and Edward Miller in 2019. MJVA organizes a gateway to dismantle the War on Drugs with equitable legalization. In 2021, MJVA worked with the CannaJustice Coalition to lead Virginia in being the first State in the South to legalize simple possession.

As one of the first independent cannabis testing labs established on the East Coast, MCR is proud to offer analytical testing and R&D services to licensed MMJ and adult-use cannabis producers, patients, doctors, researchers, and homegrowers.  MCR Labs partners with advocacy groups, educators, and fellow researchers to inform the public and encourage safe consumption practices.

Big Hope Project, a 501c3 organization based in Boston, MA conducts free restorative justice services to uplift and empower communities disproportionately harmed by the War On Drugs. Big Hope Project is a Black, Returning-Citizen, & Veteran led organization specializing in education, digital marketing, advocacy, and consulting with deep roots to the inner-cities of Massachusetts.

Stonedware was born out of the desire to create designer smokeware that is not only functional, but beautiful enough to leave sitting on your coffee table. We’re a small, woman owned and operated, USA made, handcrafted business that encourages the normalization and elevation of smoking accessories and routines.

The Alliance for Cannabis Transparency (ACT) is a coalition of professionals and advocates working to increase cannabis access for North Carolinians for the betterment of our community and state. ACT is non-partisan, community-centered and backed by research and data. Our goal is to increase safe access, while providing education around the plant to constituents and politicians.

Some strange description

outro: Parabola Center is accepting fifty additional Partners who support our mission and are interested in a unique opportunity to support our leading think tank pushing for more equitable cannabis laws. You’ll receive an exclusive invitation to quarterly virtual listening sessions over the next year as well as our annual federal policy educational boot camp. You will also be listed on our website among our 100 inaugural Partners. If you are interested in becoming a partner, email [shaleen@parabolacenter.com](mailto:shaleen@parabolacenter.com) with your company or individual name and a link to your website.
introContent:
Parabola Center for Law and Policy is proud to announce our partnership with fifty leading small companies and organizations who represent what the cannabis industry should look like. This partnership allows select organizations to join us in supporting policy solutions at the federal level that prevent marijuana monopolies and support a fair, competitive marketplace.  

Our Partners represent some of the most innovative and successful independent businesses and organizations in the country, and they play a key role in fulfilling the Parabola Center's purpose of uplifting real businesses owned by everyday people, not massive corporations. Each Partner has their own unique and compelling story that serves as a valuable contribution to our work developing policy solutions to the most pressing challenges facing small cannabis businesses. 

We will be partnering with fifty additional organizations who share our goals and believe in a competitive marketplace where small businesses and historically disenfranchised can thrive in the legal cannabis industry. If you are interested in becoming a Parabola Partner, click here to learn more
